CC12159A436A489E80092C9DC7D0B7DA.description:
with increasing
independence use frequently
occurring regular plural
nouns, verbs,
prepositions, and
question words;  ask and answer
interrogatives (wh- questions); and produce and expand
simple sentences
in shared language
activities.

073A04C9FE2C44A0B9BDEC39CADB3F22.description:
with support (context and
visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
regular plural nouns,
verbs, and prepositions; use and respond to
question words; and produce and expand
simple sentences
in shared language
activities.

BB7F0C8DF8C04AAFBEF23C84BF70D9DF.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
regular plural nouns,
verbs, and prepositions; use and respond to
question words; and produce simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

C5B4420B1F5A4EA4B1E402A96907EF25.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use
frequently occurring
nouns, verbs, and short
phrases, respond to yes/no and
wh- questions, and produce a few simple
sentences
in shared language
activities.

6DB15858C1CF461DABDA1AB0AE476888.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), recognize and use a
small number of
frequently occurring
nouns and verbs, and understand and respond
to simple questions.

F7F49A25249E4B36921E6CC304FA8282.description:
An ELL can make accurate
use of standard
English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate

speech and
writing.

2D835419C72A4A78B422B7A303395CFF.description:
with support (including
visual aids), retell a short sequence
of events from
experience or a familiar
story, with a beginning,
middle, and end
using frequently
occurring linking words.

1F05800D4D76404581425C11928D5BB4.description:
with support (including
visual aids, context), retell a simple sequence
of events from
experience or a familiar
story
with increasingly
independent control of
frequently occurring
linking words.

FA2F364F660B4C90AA429760E5EACB61.description:
with support (including
visual aids, context), retell several events
from experience or a
familiar story
with developing control of
some frequently occurring
linking words (e.g., and,
then).

C2FC8F6D4DE94F7BA184BDDE0EFB0290.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent gradeappropriate

speech and
text.

38E0DCE6EE384E83B1F2B9352EC69748.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer and ask
questions about the
meaning of words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

999B942C800244A8AB1A5EF737E3BEF6.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer and sometimes
ask questions about the
meaning of words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about a variety of
topics, experiences, or
events.

AFD3F5B182C847DB85050D6D89AD755F.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), answer questions to help
determine the meaning
of some words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

1579643E4B33435498C3824F623F18D6.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), recognize the meaning of
some frequently
occurring words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

16ABF65F4C8D4B1FAC5451DEBAB6C368.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), recognize the meaning of
a few frequently
occurring words
in simple oral
presentations and readalouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

AB4199BBB9114AC093AB03B1C7864067.description:
An ELL can determine the
meaning of
words and
phrases in oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text.

D7B5A834EFA545B3B4352AB518520C77.description:
show awareness of
differences between
informal (“playground
speech”) and language
appropriate to the
classroom, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

3068EE78966F4B57BEB72FDD4329F757.description:
show a developing
awareness of the
difference between
appropriate language for
the playground and
language for the
classroom.

0B0536D2CD624324B6E485DCFF6060CB.description:
An ELL can adapt language
choices to
purpose, task,
and audience
when speaking
and writing.

71681FBAFBFF4D1781BF79842DDA19DF.description:
with prompting and
support, identify appropriate
reasons an author or
speaker gives to
support main points.

59C5B78AA1DF41938E3B2E308B2B2E04.description:
with prompting and
support, identify a reason an
author or speaker gives
to support a point.

9CD6DC1F856841EDA88EBFA4EA2152D0.description:
An ELL can analyze and
critique the
arguments of
others orally and
in writing.

9DA8A20B89B944148DA5BA0AC848954D.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing increasing
control

7385D648AFEA4DB4985E19F88481565A.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing increasing
control.

808E6FB4B5114736881526DFC14FE4F4.description:
with prompting and
support from adults recall information from experience or use
information from
provided sources to
answer a question
showing developing
control.

ED1A58F43BD24E1682681B17A24ABC81.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or use
information from a
provided source to
answer a question.

FE948CBFFA7C413FA35ED6B6015C75AA.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, recall information from
experience or from a
provided source.

87ED510D4E734DCF8219C10DD69FE2AE.description:
An ELL can conduct
research and
evaluate and
communicate
findings to
answer
questions or
solve problems.

BF71135640BC4AA4ABE56C7A14C8EFC4.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a variety of topics
or stories
showing increasing
control.

E6A013AD0213454B90155136FC347501.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a variety of topics or
stories
showing increasing control.

6D7D31FCD00D43ACA07815FBBB460E8E.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a familiar topic or
story
showing developing control.

F0312822EED44855B618D08419136467.description:
express an opinion or
preference
about a familiar topic
showing emerging control.

58504314A53D4FE7BEEFC17C59AB3BD5.description:
express a feeling or
opinion
about a familiar topic
showing limited control.

8801F014B6F649E9896E0CA1FBB3CDCB.description:
An ELL can construct grade-appropriate
oral
and written
claims and
support them
with reasoning
and evidence.

E922ACDF08824EEFAEE0460DE8CFF862.description:
make simple oral
presentations and compose short written
texts
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

EBF8E4CB077A48CEBC79766E9E3FB317.description:
tell or dictate simple
messages
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

E6B9BCFA9C724C12847FA8DFCD7C5BD3.description:
communicate
information or feelings
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

A637BC95A25E48048D2F156BA2A5CDE3.description:
communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

8C90526F089A49B797F26C81615EC36C.description:
communicate simple
information or feelings
about familiar topics or
experiences.

AEE84704464F4584813EBD8FF532F7D8.description:
An ELL can speak and write
about gradeappropriate

complex literary
and
informational
texts and topics

5C6ACD04FB1242E6B752BC17E3E26825.description:
participate in
conversations and
discussions, ask and answer
questions, and follow rules for
discussion
about a variety of topics.

AA5CA626D8D84A85B66C0E5DF59B54D4.description:
participate in
conversations and
discussions, ask and answer simple
questions, and follow increasing
number of rules for
discussion
about a variety of topics.

D3C0C6DA62DA448F8419F9EBEC562751.description:
participate in short
conversations, follow some rules for
discussion, and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

031C059EF5014CF88E68EA1F3D060E56.description:
participate in short
conversations and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

BEEACF22AFF94538AABCF9206EA4EE1A.description:
listen with limited
participation in short
conversations  and respond to simple
yes/no and some whquestions
about familiar topics.

9D8896DBB426409B814CF14BD4FA35D8.description:
An ELL can participate in
grade-appropriate
oral and written
exchanges of
information,
ideas, and
analyses,
responding to
peer, audience, or
reader comments
and questions.

4817C281A7E44F3E9000FE078AFA7987.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use a
wide range of strategies
to: identify main topics, answer questions about
key details, and retell familiar stories
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations

0CD40748198645829070B4DCEBC0C195.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use an
increasing range of
strategies to: identify main topics, answer questions
about key details or
parts of stories, and retell events
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations

C90EAD04545D49708FB28A636F102A3D.description:
with prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use a developing set of
strategies to: identify main topics and ask and answer questions
about key details
from read-alouds and oral
presentations.

143C4D0DE190435B980B4725D44231E9.description:
with prompting and support
(including context and visual
aids), use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify some key words
and phrases
from read-alouds and oral
presentations

6E8B65B8D1C242EBA85444DAEA4D6F3A.description:
with prompting and
support (including
context and visual aids),
use a very limited set of
strategies to:  identify a few key
words
from read-alouds and
oral presentations of
information or stories

BD3FB9EE474A4D2D8CB3039FD044A5F1.description:
An ELL can construct
meaning from
oral presentations
and literary and
informational text
through grade appropriate

listening, reading,
and viewing.
